        <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Note)

million; FY2007&#160;&#160;(Y) (94) million</font></div>

                              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Total

                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;(forecast)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td valign="middle" width="11%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#65293;</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td valign="middle" width="11%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#65293;</font></div>
                                  </td>

                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#65293;</font></div>

                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
dividend forecast for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2010 has not been
decided. Advantest takes earnings forecast into consideration and intends to
promptly disclose the relevant dividend forecast when such forecast becomes
available.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.
Projected Results for FY2009 (April 1, 2009 through March 31,
2010)</font></div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 9pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest&#8217;s
business focuses on test systems for semiconductors, and relies heavily on the
capital expenditure of semiconductor manufacturers, test houses and
foundries.&#160;&#160;The capital expenditures of these companies are determined
primarily by factors such as current or future trends in the demand for
semiconductors.&#160;&#160;In the semiconductor-related market, DRAM and flash
memory prices have shown signs of recovery, however trends for end-user products
including automobiles, mobile phones, and consumer electronics remain uncertain
and the possibility of significant change still lies ahead with M&amp;A activity
now underway in the semiconductor industry. Thus, Advantest refrains from making
any predictions on the timing of the recovery of capital
expenditures.&#160;&#160;Because of the great difficulty involved in forecasting
earnings in such an operating environment, the earnings forecast for the fiscal
year ending March 31, 2010 has not been presented.&#160;&#160;Advantest intends
to promptly disclose the relevant earnings forecast when such disclosure becomes
possible.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4.
Others</font></div>

              </td>

      changes in subsidiaries during this fiscal year (changes in scope of
      consolidation resulting from changes in subsidiaries):
  None</font></div>

                                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#12288;</font></div>

      income (loss)</font></div>

      (loss) before income</font></div>
                                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">taxes</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Explanation
on the Appropriate Use of Future Earnings Projections and Other Special
Instructions</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">This
document contains &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; that are based on Advantest&#8217;s
current expectations, estimates and projections.&#160;&#160;These
forward-looking statements are subject to known and unknown risks, uncertainties
and other factors that may cause Advantest&#8217;s actual results, levels of activity,
performance or achievements to be materially different from those expressed or
implied by such forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;These factors include:
(i) changes in demand for the products and services produced and offered by
Advantest&#8217;s customers, including semiconductors, communications services and
electronic goods; (ii) circumstances relating to Advantest&#8217;s investment in
technology, including its ability to timely develop products that meet the
changing needs of semiconductor manufacturers and communications network
equipment and components makers and service providers; (iii) significant changes
in the competitive environment in the major markets where Advantest purchases
materials, components and supplies for the production of its products or where
its products are produced, distributed or sold; and (iv) changes in economic
conditions, currency exchange rates or political stability in the major markets
where Advantest procures materials, components and supplies for the production
of its principal products or where its products are produced, distributed or
sold.&#160;&#160;A discussion of these and other factors which may affect
Advantest's actual results, levels of activity, performance or achievements is
contained in the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8220;</font>Operating and
Financial Review<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8221;</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8220;</font>Key Information -
Risk Factors<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8221;</font>
and <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8220;</font>Information on the
Company<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8221;</font>
sections and elsewhere in Advantest's annual report on Form 20-F, which is on
file with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission.</font></div>

      year</font></div>

      (decrease)</font></div>

      input received</font></div>

      income (loss)</font></div>

      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
fiscal year ended March 31, 2009, the global economy saw a continued
deceleration during the first half of the fiscal year due to the widening of the
sub-prime loan crisis in the U.S., and the collapse of leading US investment
bank Lehman Brothers in September 2008 triggered further rapid deterioration in
the global economy.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
semiconductor-related market, although excess inventory and price pressures
persisted since last fiscal year, many hoped at the beginning of this fiscal
year that desktop high performance PC replacements and Vista adoption, as well
as demand for home electronics ahead of the Beijing Olympics, would drive an
upturn in the market. However, demand fell short of expectations, and
semiconductor manufacturers continued to take a cautious stance on capital
expenditures, prolonging Advantest&#8217;s extremely difficult business
environment.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Furthermore,
ripple effects of the financial crisis in the U.S. spread to Europe and to
emerging markets in Southeast Asia and elsewhere, which had previously been
healthy. Decreasing demand for end-user products reinforced the defensive stance
of semiconductor manufacturers, many of whom implemented production cuts and
froze or postponed their capital expenditure programs starting from the second
fiscal half.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
response to these dramatic environmental shifts, Advantest actively trimmed
costs throughout the fiscal year, and also implemented emergency measures to
improve profitability in November 2008. These measures include reduction of
fixed costs such as, workforce cuts, and reduced compensation for executives and
managers. However, the business climate continued to deteriorate once entering
2009 and Advantest responded with follow-on measures by reviewing
underperforming product lines, acceptance of voluntary retirement from full-time
employees and among others, aiming for further workforce optimization as its
planned structural reforms.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">However,
orders input received and net sales declined steeply compared to the previous
fiscal year, causing Advantest to recognize inventory valuation losses of (Y)
8.7 billion, restructuring costs of (Y) 5.1 billion, impairment loss on
property, plant, and equipment of (Y) 13.8 billion and a valuation allowance on
deferred tax assets of (Y) 45.1 billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Accordingly,
orders input received decreased by 69.1% from the previous fiscal year to (Y)
50.1 billion, net sales decreased by 58.1% from the previous fiscal year to (Y)
76.7 billion, operating loss was (Y) 49.5 billion, loss before income taxes and
equity in loss of affiliated company was (Y) 52.8 billion, and net loss was (Y)
74.9 billion.&#160;&#160;Furthermore, Advantest&#8217;s overseas sales ratio fell to
67.7%, compared to 69.3% in the previous fiscal year.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font></div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Conditions
of business by segment are described below.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&lt;Semiconductor
and Component Test System Segment&gt;</font></div>

      income (loss)</font></div>
                                          </td>
                                          <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">23.3</font></div>
                                          </td>
                                          <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(28.9)</font></div>
                                          </td>
                                          <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#65293;</font></font></div>
                                          </td>
                                        </tr>
                                    </table>
                                  </div>
                                </div>
                              </div>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
Semiconductor and Component Test Systems segment, the semiconductor downturn
combined with global economic fears sharply curbed major manufacturers&#8217; appetite
for capital expenditures.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, Advantest&#8217;s results for both
memory and non-memory test systems remained weak.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
memory arena, the much-anticipated transition to DDR3-DRAM semiconductors for
high-performance computers was delayed, while oversupply continued to hold down
prices of DDR2-DRAM, and semiconductor manufacturers restrained investment in
DRAM test systems.&#160;&#160;Demand for flash memory semiconductors were also
weak caused by oversupply, and in addition, falling sales of mobile phones
placed pressure on prices, causing capital expenditures in flash memory test
systems to remain weak.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
non-memory sector, strong sales of notebooks and other mobile PCs were recorded
in the first half of the fiscal year, and semiconductor manufacturers in related
fields showed signs of renewing their capital expenditures to increase
production.&#160;&#160;However, the demand associated with the Beijing Olympics
fell short of expectations and a recovery in capital expenditures did not occur.
Moreover, the worldwide decline in consumer confidence suppressed demand for
products using semiconductors, leading to a continued weak demand in test
systems for consumer, automotive, and LCD driver ICs.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As a
result of the above, orders input received in the Semiconductor and Component
Test System segment was (Y) 26.1 billion, a 77.4% decrease in comparison to the
previous fiscal year. Net sales were (Y) 49.2 billion, 62.6% decrease in
comparison to the previous fiscal year, and operating loss was (Y) 28.9
billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&lt;Mechatronics
System Segment&gt;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 333pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div align="left">
        <div align="left">
          <div align="left">
            <div align="left">
              <div align="left">

                                  <td align="left" valign="middle" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

      </font></td>

                                  <td valign="middle" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

      input received</font></div>
                                  </td>

                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">30.3</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;9.1</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(69.9%)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Net
      sales</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">34.9</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">14.4</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(58.8%)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Operating
      income (loss)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3.3</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(11.9)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#65293;</font></font></div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                            </table>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The weak
results for memory and non-memory test systems also weakened demand for test
handlers and device interface products, which are used together with test
systems. In particular, the downturn in the DRAM market produced a dramatic
decline in demand for back-end test handlers.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As a
result of the above, orders input received in the Mechatronics System segment
was (Y) 9.1 billion (a 69.9% decrease in comparison to the previous fiscal
year). Net sales were (Y) 14.4 billion (a 58.8% decrease in comparison to the
previous fiscal year) and operating loss was (Y) 11.9 billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>

Corporation (FY2008)</font><br></div>

                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

      sales</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">19.3</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">15.8</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(18.2%)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                                <tr>
                                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Operating
      income (loss)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3.2</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(1.1)</font></div>
                                  </td>
                                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="25%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#65293;</font></font></div>
                                  </td>
                                </tr>
                            </table>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </div>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Owing to
a decline in demand for maintenance services, and reflecting the weak
performance of the semiconductor market, resulting from the depressed
semiconductor related market, orders input received in the Services, Support and
Other segment was (Y) 15.6 billion, a 19.1% decline in comparison to the
previous fiscal year. Net sales were (Y) 15.8 billion (a 18.2% decrease in
comparison to the previous fiscal year) and operating loss was (Y) 1.1
billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2)
Prospects for the Upcoming Fiscal Year</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Despite
economic and employment stimulus packages recently announced by many countries
to counter the global economic slowdown, the timing of the recovery remains
uncertain and visibility is still limited.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
semiconductor-related market, DRAM and flash memory prices have shown signs of
recovery, however trends in demand for end-user products including automobiles,
mobile phones, and consumer electronics remain uncertain and the possibility of
significant change still lies ahead with M&amp;A activity now underway in the
semiconductor industry. Thus, Advantest refrains from making any predictions on
the timing of the recovery of capital expenditures.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In this
operating environment, Advantest will focus on deriving efficiency gains in its
research and development and manufacturing processes by consolidating
subsidiaries, reduction of fixed costs through the consolidation and sale of
business offices and other facilities, improvement of the productivity of
in-house processes, reinforcement of the Advantest Group&#8217;s sales structure, and
development of in new products and entry into new businesses.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(2)
Financial Condition</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1)
Assets, Liabilities and Net Assets</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Total
assets at the end of FY2008 was (Y) 202.1 billion, a decrease of (Y) 96.6
billion compared to the previous fiscal year, due primarily to a decrease of (Y)
41.9 billion in cash and cash equivalents, a decrease of (Y) 19.7 billion in
trade receivables, a decrease of (Y) 18.5 billion in deferred tax assets and an
increase of (Y) 25.1 billion in short-term investments.&#160;&#160;The amount of
total liabilities was (Y) 38.4 billion, a decrease of (Y) 6.1 billion compared
to the end of the previous fiscal year, due primarily to a decrease of (Y) 7.0
billion in trade accounts payable. Shareholders&#8217; equity was (Y) 163.6
billion.&#160;&#160;Equity to assets ratio was 81.0%, a decrease of 4.1
percentage point compared to the previous fiscal year.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2) Cash
Flow Condition</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash and
cash equivalents held at the end of FY2008 were (Y) 105.5 billion, a decrease of
(Y) 41.9 billion from previous fiscal year.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Significant
cash flows during this fiscal year and their causes are described
below.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net cash
provided by operating activities was (Y) 2.4 billion.&#160;&#160;This amount was
primarily attributable to a decrease of (Y) 19.3 billion in trade receivables, a
decrease of (Y) 17.8 billion in inventories and an adjustment of noncash items
such as depreciation and amortization, despite the net loss being (Y) 74.9
billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right">&#160;</div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net cash
used in investing activities was (Y) 32.5 billion.&#160;&#160;This amount was
primarily attributable to expenditures in short-term investments in the amount
of (Y) 26.2 billion and purchases of property, plant and equipment in the amount
of (Y) 4.9 billion.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net cash
used in financing activities was (Y) 8.9 billion.&#160;&#160;This amount was
primarily attributable to dividend payments.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following table illustrates the historical movements of certain cash flow
indexes:</font></div>

              <td align="right" valign="top" width="13%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="13%" style="BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

              <td align="right" valign="top" width="13%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 2px solid; BORDER-LEFT: black 2px solid; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">195.9</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stockholders&#8217;
equity ratio: stockholders&#8217; equity / total assets</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stockholders&#8217;
equity ratio based on market prices: market capitalization / total
assets</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Debt to
annual cash flow ratio: interest-bearing liabilities / operating cash
flows</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Interest
coverage ratio: operating cash flows / interest payments</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Notes)&#160;&#160;&#160;1.
These indexes are calculated using U.S. GAAP figures.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2. Market
capitalization is calculated based on issued and outstanding shares excluding
treasury stock.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>3. Operating cash flows are the cash
flows provided by operating activities on the consolidated statements of cash
flows.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4.
Interest-bearing liabilities include all liabilities on the consolidated balance
sheets that incur interest.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(3) Basic
Policy on Distribution of Profits and Distribution for FY2008 and Distribution
Forecast for FY2009</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Based on
the premise that long-term and continued growth in corporate value is
fundamental to the creation of shareholder value, Advantest deems the consistent
distribution of profits to be the most important management
priority.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, Advantest engages in active distribution of
profits based on consolidated business performance.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">With
respect to the distribution of retained earnings, Advantest makes payout
decisions after taking into consideration consolidated business performance,
financial conditions, as well as the need for strategic investment for
mid-to-long-term business development.&#160;&#160;While aiming to make
consistent distributions, because of the fluctuation of the market in which it
operates, Advantest makes dividend payouts following a target payout ratio of
20% or more.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Retained
earnings are devoted to research and development, streamlining efforts, overseas
expansion, investments in new businesses and resources for M&amp;A activities,
with an aim to strengthen Advantest&#8217;s business position and enhance its
corporate value.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In order
to maintain capital strategies responsive to changes in the operating
environment, Advantest will repurchase its own shares from time to time through
taking into account factors such as trends in stock price, capital efficiency
and cash flow.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In this
fiscal year, Advantest decided, pursuant to the above profit distribution
policy, to distribute a year end dividend of (Y) 5 consistent with the revised
forecast announced on February 25, 2009, with a payment date of June 2, 2009.
Since Advantest paid an interim dividend of (Y) 25 on December 1, 2008, the
total dividend per share for the fiscal year will be (Y) 30.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest
has elected not to publish a dividend forecast for fiscal 2009 at this time, due
to the Company&#8217;s view that its results will take time to recover, as explicated
in the prospects section above. Payout decisions will take future results into
consideration and will be announced when they are available.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2.
Organization of the Advantest Group</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#12288;</font>The
following diagram shows the business relationships among the major affiliated
companies of the Advantest Group.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><img src="chart3.jpg" alt=""></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">There are
13 other consolidated subsidiaries and 1 equity method affiliate in addition to
those mentioned in the above diagram.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Consolidated
subsidiaries (22 domestic; 17 overseas; 39 total)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Equity
method affiliate (1 domestic)</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><img src="arrow.jpg" alt="">&#160;&#160;&#160; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#65306;</font>Main flow of
products and services</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">8</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font><br><br></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.
Management Policy</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(1)
Advantest&#8217;s Basic Management Policy</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest
has established a corporate vision of &#8220;Technology Support on the Leading Edge&#8221;,
and its corporate mission of &#8220;Quest for the Essence&#8221;.&#160;&#160;Guided by these
principles, Advantest respects each of its stakeholders, strives to maintain
harmony with society, and aims for the sustained development of the Company and
the improvement of corporate value while contributing to the goal of a
sustainable society.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(2)
Target Financial Index</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest
applies the &#8220;AVA&#8221; (Advantest Value Added), a financial index incorporating the
concept of EVA<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>(Economic
Value Added) *, as a significant management indicator, along with profit margin,
ROE and cash flows.&#160;&#160;Specifically, Advantest will set the minimum
return-on-investment ratio (&#8220;hurdle rate&#8221;) for evaluating AVA at 8% and a
mid-term target at 12% or more with an aim to further enhance corporate value
and shareholder value.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">*&#8221;EVA<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#174;</font>&#8221;
is a registered trademark of Stern Stewart &amp; Co.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(3)
Mid-and-Long-term Business Strategy and Issues to be Addressed</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While
maintaining &#8220;Measurements&#8221; as our core competence in mid-and-long term,
Advantest intends to improve its corporate value by establishing a management
and financial structure that responds timely to changes in the global market,
and by aiming to increase market share by introducing fine products that will
inspire the market demands of the next generation.&#160;&#160;To achieve these
objectives, Advantest promotes to further strengthen its product development
operations and improve production efficiency by focusing on certain businesses,
while strengthening its overseas operations and support system in the U.S.,
Europe and Asia.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Confronting
deepening capital spending cuts by semiconductor manufacturers and the likely
prolongation of Advantest&#8217;s weakened operating environment, the Company has
announced the following plans for structural reforms to strengthen management
practices, workforce optimization targeted to reinforce management structure,
the merger of four manufacturing subsidiaries into one, the merger likewise of
four software subsidiaries into one, ongoing review of underperforming business
segments, exploration of and investment into new businesses, payroll cost
reductions, and the consolidation and sale of facilities.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Through
&#8220;Activate 21,&#8221; a corporate initiative launched in October 2005, Advantest has
pursued greater efficiency, cost savings, and financial health from a global
perspective. The initiative concluded in March 2009, with positive results
including productivity improvements from the just-in-time (&#8220;JIT&#8221;) production
system, inventory optimization, and standardization of design specifications
leading to enhanced research and development efficiency. The Company&#8217;s new
corporate initiative, starting from fiscal 2009, will incorporate detailed
measures and goals after the structural reforms that Advantest is currently
carrying out.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>

        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">4. Consolidated Financial Statements and Other Information</div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">&#160;</div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">(1) Consolidated Balance Sheets (Unaudited)</div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">&#160;</div>

      assets:</font></div>

                    <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr bgcolor="white">
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="70%" style="PADDING-LEFT: 0pt">
                      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Basic</font></div>
                    </td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(89,328</font></td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">

      </font></td>

        </div>
      </div>

      other comprehensive income (loss)</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="70%" style="PADDING-LEFT: 0pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">

      from sale of treasury stock</font></div>

    <div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">(5) Notes on Preconditions to Going Concerns:&#160; None</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">15</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="right">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(6) Notes
to the Consolidated Financial Statements</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Note
1)&#160;&#160;&#160;Accounting Principles, Procedures and the Presentation of
the Consolidated</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Financial
Statements</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)
Terminology, Form and Method of Preparation of the Consolidated Financial
Statements</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest
Corporation prepares these consolidated financial statements in accordance with
the accounting principles, procedures, terminology, form and method of
preparation required in the United States of America in connection with its
issuance of American Depository Shares as established under Accounting Research
Bulletins (&#8220;ARB&#8221;), Accounting Principles Board (&#8220;APB&#8221;) statements, Statements of
Financial Accounting Standards (&#8220;SFAS&#8221;) and other relevant sources (collectively
&#8220;U.S. GAAP&#8221;).&#160;&#160;However, Advantest Corporation and its consolidated
subsidiaries prepare their unconsolidated financial statements in accordance
with accounting principles generally accepted in the country of their
domicile.&#160;&#160;Certain adjustments and reclassifications have been
incorporated in the accompanying non-consolidated financial statements to
present them in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the
United States of America.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)
Preparation of Consolidated Financial Statements and Registration with the U.S.
Securities and Exchange Commission</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest
Corporation became listed on the New York Stock Exchange on September 17, 2001
(local time) by means of an issuance of American Depository Shares, and has been
filing a Form 20-F (equivalent to the Annual Securities Report in Japan) with
the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission since FY2001.&#160;&#160;Advantest
prepares the consolidated financial statements in its Form 20-F in accordance
with U.S. GAAP.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(c) Scope
of Consolidation and Application of the Equity Method</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Advantest&#8217;s
consolidated financial statements include financial statements of Advantest
Corporation and its majority-owned subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;With respect to
variable interest entities as provided in the U.S. Financial Accounting
Standards Board&#8217;s Interpretation No. 46 (Revised December 2003) &#8211; &#8220;Consolidation
of Variable Interest Entities&#8221;, Advantest does not have any such entity to be
included in its consolidated financial statements.&#160;&#160;All significant
intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in
consolidation.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following table sets forth the number of consolidated subsidiaries and equity
method affiliates of Advantest:</font></div>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">&#160;</div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Advantest
Corporation (FY2008)</font></div><br></div>

            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;Changes
in the scope of consolidation:</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Excluded
(1):&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Advantest
Information Systems, Inc. *</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">*Advantest
Information Systems, Inc. was merged into Advantest Corporation on August 1,
2008.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Note
2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Significant Accounting Policies</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Accounting
Changes)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
September 2006, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued SFAS
No. 157, &#8220;Fair Value Measurements&#8221; (&#8220;SFAS157&#8221;) which defines fair value,
establishes a framework for measuring fair value, and enhances fair value
measurement disclosure.&#160;&#160;SFAS 157 does not expand the use of fair
value to any new circumstances, but does require additional disclosures in both
annual and quarterly reports. Advantest adopted SFAS 157 and its related
amendments for financial assets and liabilities on April 1, 2008. The adoption
of SFAS 157 did not have a significant impact on its consolidated results of
operations and financial condition.&#160;&#160;SFAS 157 will be effective for
non-financial assets and liabilities in financial statements issued for fiscal
years beginning after November 15, 2008 and is required to be adopted by
Advantest in the first quarter beginning April 1, 2009.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">There are
no other changes pertaining to accounting policies other than as mentioned above
from the fiscal year 2007 Annual Report which was submitted on June 26,
2008.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="40%">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#12288;</font>Net sales to

                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
      <div align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Notes)</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1.
Adjustments to operating income (loss) in Corporate principally represent
corporate general and administrative expenses and research and development
expenses related to fundamental research activities that are not allocated to
operating segments.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2.
Advantest uses the operating income (loss) before stock option compensation
expense for management's analysis of business segment results.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3. Total
assets included in Corporate primarily consist of cash and cash equivalents
assets for general corporate use and assets used for fundamental research
activities, which are not allocated to reportable segments.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 90pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Total</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Notes)</font></div>

      </font></div>

                </td>
                <td>
                  <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net
      sales to unaffiliated customers are based on the customer&#8217;s
      location.</font></div>

      of the segments includes primarily the following countries or

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Notes)</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1.
Adjustments to operating income (loss) in Corporate principally represent
corporate general and administrative expenses and research and development
expenses related to fundamental research activities that are not allocated to
corporate general administrative expense and segment by geographic area. Stock
option expense of (Y) 858 million and (Y) 248 million for FY2007 and FY2008,
respectively, are included in Corporate operating expenses.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2. Total
assets included in Corporate primarily consist of the parent company&#8217;s cash and
cash equivalents, assets for general corporate use and assets used for
fundamental research activities.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -9pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
March 31, 2008 and March 31, 2009, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Advantest held 2,309,980 shares and
3,938,980 shares respectively, of issued stock options that are excluded from
the calculation of net income per share (diluted) because they do not currently
have a dilutive effect.</font></font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(Omission
of Disclosure)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">For
purpose of annual release in Japan, notes for lease transactions, related party
transactions, income taxes, financial instruments, securities, derivative
transactions, accrued pension and severance costs, stock options, among others,
have not been disclosed because such disclosure in this consolidated financial
results is not considered significant for this presentation in
Japan.</font></div>

      </font></td>

                            <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                            <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                          </tr>
                      </table>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

      <pre><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(All non-consolidated financial information has been prepared in accordance <br>with accounting principles generally accepted in Japan.)</font></pre>

      </font></td>
